alert.note: Alert for McKean; Northern Lycoming; Potter; Sullivan; Tioga; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 6:22PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF MCKEAN...WARREN... POTTER...SULLIVAN...NORTHERN LYCOMING...AND TIOGA COUNTIES THIS EVENING... HAZARDS...Heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 619 PM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 12 miles east of Hornell to Olean to 15 miles east of Erie and moving southeast at 20 MPH. Moderate snow showers were also occuring in the northern tier of Pennsylvania ahead of the band of heaviest snow. THIS BAND OF HEAVIEST SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Shinglehouse around 655 PM EST. Columbus around 700 PM EST. Spring Creek and Lottsville around 720 PM EST. Roulette around 730 PM EST. Garland around 735 PM EST. Coudersport around 740 PM EST. * This includes the following highways... Route 6 from Columbus to the Bradford county line. Route 15 from Oak Lynn to Lawrenceville. Route 219 from north of Wilcox to the New York border. Route 220 from south of Muncy Valley to Dushore. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
